storyInfo: A night of legends passes into history, and the variables brought forth during the Major slowly make their mark on all of Kazimierz. However, things are far from over. Margaret's light illuminates the way forward, and certain individuals prepare to set off.

attributes.text: 'If you deem the waves too raucous, then command the ocean to be still.'
'Civilization flourishes, the city roars forth. The only things capable of destroying them, are they themselves.'
'Do not entrust that battle to time, for they will defeat even time. Grasp that duty, for you must entrust it to yourself.'

attributes.content: Something truly unexpected has occurred at the Major! Two championship winners have gone to the Wall of Champions together, an unprecedented event!
attributes.name: A Voice on the Television

attributes.content: Moreover, the Radiant Knight rejected her award from the Knights Association, and left on her own!
attributes.name: A Voice on the Television

attributes.content: What a blasphemous turn of events.
attributes.name: A Voice on the Television

attributes.content: Ow, ow, ow...
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Old man, if you can't fight anymore, then keep your head down. Just leave the rest to Maria and Zofia!
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Should we step outside? How dare you– Gaah! Ow, ow!
attributes.name: Old Knight

attributes.content: Why are you staring at your hammer like that, Marcin? Did ya start pining for the good ol' days after one night of exercise?
attributes.name: Old Craftsman

attributes.content: Maybe a bit.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: I wonder how the Nearl family is doing.
attributes.name: Bald Marcin

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Uncle... You're leaving the Grand Knight Territory?
attributes.name: Maria

attributes.content: Are you girls even Nearls? Stop staying so much at Zofia's. It's unbecoming.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I'll be gone for a while, so during that time... Margaret.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Are you sure you want to stay in Kazimierz?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: You should already know what you'll be up against.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Nobody will understand you.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Of course. I've always known that.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: If that's the case, then I have nothing else to say.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Why the sudden change of heart?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Toland...
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Why'd you decide to leave all of a sudden, huh? For what purpose?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: What do you see when you look at me now?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Why are you asking? You should know better than anyone else.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But to be completely honest, you've let us all down.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You don't have to hold rank in the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi, or be the person who changes the National Council. But you should at least have been our hero, our Nearl.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I don't know where you plan on going after you leave the city, but let me say this –– you let them all down. If they see your face again, they may well decide to take your life.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Think they can beat me?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I've given up a lot of things, Toland.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: But I still find myself often clinging to a rather idealistic sentiment.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: They should still be out there somewhere.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: He was the eldest son of a war hero. My brother, the most powerful knight in the family.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: And she... is the most beautiful woman in all of Kazimierz. Elegant and dignified, like a gemstone.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: They were my pride and joy, veritable gifts from heaven. They shouldn't have disappeared without a trace like that.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: It's been over a decade.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I've never stopped thinking about it.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: It's already been fifteen years. After wasting all that time and effort, why are you now––
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: This is just... paid leave.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: All by yourself?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Isn't one person enough for a hopeless vacation?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You're not the type to get swept by the emotions the Radiant Knight brought, so I won't ask why you decided to do this––
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You know how to find me... 'Us.'
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The one I need to find... is myself.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Rhodes Island, huh.
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: They're able to provide you with treatment. And they won't force you to do anything.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Since that's the team the Radiant Knight used to play for... then I guess they're trustworthy?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Their ideals will one day illuminate this world. Even now, I still believe in them.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Will you ever head back there?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: ...I will, one day.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Be sure to spar a few rounds with me then.
attributes.name: Iwona

attributes.content: I-Iwona!
attributes.name: Justyna

attributes.content: What? Who wouldn't want to challenge the champion?
attributes.name: Iwona

attributes.content: Count me in too.
attributes.name: Greynuty

attributes.content: A legendary lineage of knights... Really gets you going, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Greynuty

attributes.content: You have my word. I'll entertain you when the time comes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Ahaha... Look at you guys, all fired up right after a tiny bit of rest..
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: You knew from the beginning you weren't one of us Infected, right?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: But you still chose to fight for us?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: I fight for the downtrodden.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: The Board is very upset.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Looks like we'll lose a few months of bonuses.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Bonuses, huh.
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: What we did cost the lives of so many Infected, so many knights, and even the Armorless Union. All that only adds up to our bonuses?
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: About that...
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Come with me, Malkiewicz. We ought to discuss where you go from here.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: What you said earlier about the telephone really made sense, after I had some time to mull it over.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Whose call are we waiting for?
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: A newsman's.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Hm... a newsman? Do we have to sit for an interview?
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: They call him that. It's just a title.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Wait a sec... Newsman? You can't mean–
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: McKee?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: It's me. Let me first introduce you to the person on the other end of the phone. He is the chairman of the Rose Paper Union, 'The Newsman' Kain.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Malkiewicz is here too.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Yes, it's an honor to speak to you.
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: I paid good money to buy Malkiewicz from Mieszko Industries. He will be my right-hand man.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: In other words, there are no strangers among us, McKee. You can call me 'father.'
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Yes, father.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Good, how's your mother doing?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Very well, father. She thinks of you often.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: And what about you? Are you married yet?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: I... Not yet, I'm afraid.
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: How are you, father? Where are you right now?
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Columbia.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: When will you come back to Kazimierz?
attributes.name: Spokesman McKee

attributes.content: Haha... It's not time for that yet, McKee.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Those short-sighted idiots don't see the truth, but Columbia is the real enemy that threatens Kazimierz.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Our newspapers have yet to cover their city, and our voices have yet to reach Columbian ears.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: The speed of their development is frightening, and we must move to contain them... to seize their markets.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: The games between countries are most fascinating, McKee.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: But, those... Nobles. Bah. So rigid in their ways... Victoria, Ursus. These powerful countries are so ignorant that one cannot help but feel for them
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Malkiewicz.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: Are you willing to give everything for the General Chamber of Commerce?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: You are a capable person. I can tell, just from reading a few words of your report.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Could it be that you still... harbor compassion for those knights?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Seems like I hit the mark.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Child, let me pose you a question.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: When the number of Kazimierz's attack ships far exceeds that of Ursus, when Columbia is flooded with Kazimierzian caravans and goods, when our border strongholds more than double in number––
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Will that be the end of war? Would Ursus still threaten us? Would Kazimierz still be weak?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Of course not.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: The knights are the true parasites on Kazimierz. Imbeciles barking for glory. Nobles? Bah.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: I heard about what happened at the Major. Does the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi think they've 'protected their honor?'
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Honor and glory. Give them as much of it as they want.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: The time, and the people, are on our side. After a few more tournaments, the masses will forget about the shockwaves brought by the Radiant Knight, and return to invest in the next round of consumption and entertainment.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: For them, arguing over 'which knight is stronger' and 'whether knight merchandise is fairly priced' is more important than looking after the dregs we leave behind.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: The country stands on our side. Kazimierz is already inextricably tied to the economic foundations laid by the K.G.C.C. Those pitiful campaign knights... Look how many have already voluntarily surrendered to us.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Malkiewicz.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: This time, you have the right to choose.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Before I answer, can I first ask a question?
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: Please do.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Mr. Czarny... Because he failed to prevent the Radiant Knight from entering the arena, he was exiled... By my standards, this is unacceptable.
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: Why did it happen?
attributes.name: Spokesman Malkiewicz

attributes.content: Oh, Mr. Czarny. I see, the turning point in your destiny, Malkiewicz. I ought to thank him too.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: However, what if I told you Mr. Czarny's disappearance–– was not directly related to the Radiant Knight incident?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: What if I told you that his exile was just a consequence of a longstanding series of power struggles, and an excuse finally being found to take him out of the picture?
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: ––Czarny was exiled by political opponents over a bribery incident a few years ago.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: It had nothing to do with the Radiant Knight... It had nothing to do with your destiny. More often than not, this is the truth of the world. The truth of modernity is one of supreme indifference.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Come, Malkiewicz.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: Let us become the voice of this world.
attributes.name: A Voice from the Phone

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: What? Not a fan of our new storefront?
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Storefront? You're... opening a shop?
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: Are you blind?
attributes.name: Monique

attributes.content: No... But, hand sanitizer?
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: Origi-Cloud Daily Wares has been the most popular brand in recent years––
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: ...and there are 'three bosses' behind the company that launched Origi-Cloud Daily Wares.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Soon, those three bosses will become a part of the General Chamber of Commerce.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: You guys...
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: Yes, but it's just for the sake of joining them.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: As you know, the more inside information we have, the more we'll know about the direction the winds blow in the future.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Sooner or later, mercenaries and assassins will become obsolete. There's no need for so many of them, and in the end, all they're good for is killing. Them, on the other hand, they can take over a country.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: This is another crossroads of our time, Platinum.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: By the way, why don't you come be our poster girl, since we're missing a clerk anyway? You're very good-looking. It'll be perfect.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Monique

attributes.content: During an upcoming mission for the Union, the three of us will 'vanish,' then we'll find the best plastic surgeon, swap faces, and become by-the-books businesspeople.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: So... you took advantage of the blackout caused by the Infected... to kill everyone with connections between the Board and the Union.
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: They deserve the credit for making it so easy.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: The Board can't stop fighting with itself, under the table or otherwise.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Whoever controls the Union holds an overwhelming advantage–– and no director dared to blatantly manipulate it, or let others do so.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: It is precisely because of this tacitly agreed restraint that they ended up losing control of the Union.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Haha, let me tell you a joke. The people of Kazimierz no longer know the name or whereabouts of the person leading the organization they hire for their hitjobs.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Does Darksteel really exist?
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: Who knows?
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Darksteel might be a single person, maybe two. Darksteel might even be a front, or just refer to the signals us Lazurites use during operations.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: But for all you know, Darksteel might've passed you on the street, or be sitting in a board meeting, or on vacation in a Sami villa.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: Nobody knows. And that's why the name strikes fear.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: One last thing. Whatever the case, you should've been a damned woman. Condemned as a scapegoat.
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: We'll have our eyes on you. You're Armorless too. Surely you wouldn't want to make enemies of us, right?
attributes.name: Roy

attributes.content: (I... have to run...)
attributes.name: Platinum

attributes.content: Doctor, Amiya.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Oh, Nearl.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: The reason I called you here is...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.options: This isn't goodbye.;We'll meet again, right?

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: If Rhodes Island ever calls for me, then I shall head to your side. Doctor, Amiya.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Great!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: I've been a drifter for many years. It isn't until now... that I've finally had the time to look back at my old home.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Maybe I should go visit my grandfather's grave...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Nearl.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Oh, Doctor, let's give them some space.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Nearl, take care of yourself!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.options: Until next time.;Be safe.;We'll meet again.

attributes.content: Of course. Godspeed.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: It's time for us to part ways as well, Nearl.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: ...Shining.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: Actually, I...
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: It's alright. I know what you're going to say.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: We will return to Londinium. Just as you've returned here.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: The past... and those sins. We'll excise them ourselves.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: Shining?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: Liz... You might really come to hate me at some point.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: But, trust me, I will always stay by your side.
attributes.name: Shining

attributes.content: I... How could I ever hate you?
attributes.name: Nightingale

attributes.content: If that time comes, and you ever need me––
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: I swear to you––
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.content: ––that the Radiant Knight, Margaret Nearl, will fight for you both.
attributes.name: Margaret

attributes.text: The lights of Kawalerielki shine brightly once more, as do the lights throughout the General Chamber.
Like the answer smeared across the city by humankind.
The curtains of night slowly begin to lift.
That is how civilization continues to flourish.

attributes.content: Three days later, in a certain village outside the Grand Knight Territory...
This is the place?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: Quaint little town, isn't it?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Do you always come stay out here?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: I used to stay at a more classic den of thieves. Even if I had my eyes on other cities, I did most of my work underground and in the black market.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But then... I met some people. They changed the way I saw things.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I'll skip to the important part though. A bit after that, we fought a battle with the Rusthammers. Know those guys? A bunch of lunatics.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Many people have the wrong idea about the Rusthammers, that they're just a band of thieves. But they aren't. During that battle, I saw kids, teenagers, swinging metal pipes.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Pretty crazy, huh?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Yeah... Sounds scary.
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: That is what makes 'em truly scary.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The Rusthammers weren't born to fight against civilization. They were born of the development of civilization.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Don't expect them to have some end goal in mind, or some greater purpose. It's a mistake to treat them like a group of rational actors––
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: They're just the orphans of civilization. They were born when it moved on, but couldn't bring everyone along.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Homeless, with nowhere to go, forced to survive in the barren wilderness littered with Originium. They are the Catastrophes.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Thanks to them, we've become united, and as a result, we've also realized a few things...
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: That we don't want to end up like those lunatics.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: So? What are we gonna do?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: I want you to meet a few people.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: What kind of people?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: A few Infected.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Infected?
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: A few farmers, a few knights.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: A real melting pot, huh.
attributes.name: Sona

attributes.content: A few manual laborers, a few bounty hunters.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: A few village chiefs unable to make ends meet, a few worn-out nobles.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: A few college students, a few illiterates.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: A few people trying to change Kazimierz. A few people who were changed by Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Don't be surprised already. The real surprise has only just begun.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Sona, you've asked me before, what's the point of thwarting the General Chamber. What's the point of the knights.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: I'd like to pose the same question back to you. Before the rise of the merchants, before Kazimierz was firmly in the grasp of the General Chamber of Commerce––
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ––who was it that exploited the poor and oppressed the masses? Who hanged the Infected, while hiding inside the massive edifices erected by and to their power?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The knights.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: We don't prop up the reality of a villain just beacuse there isn't one now. Why bother though? We always lose out in the end.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: But to be honest, though you rarely hear the words 'General Chamber of Commerce' spoken without curses attached... even a broken clock is right twice a day.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The people who've been left behind by the city should unite.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Toland, is this...?
attributes.name: A Haggard Girl

attributes.content: An Infected knight from the Grand Knight Territory. We've formed a working relationship.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Are the others here?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Yes, they're all inside...
attributes.name: A Haggard Girl

attributes.content: Good. Why don't you head inside as well, Clore......
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It's nearly light out.
attributes.name: Toland
